bioghist.p: Villanova University's College of Liberal Arts and Sciences is home to a number of academic centers and institutes dedicated to promoting the mission of the College within their area of concentration. In addition to offering courses, centers and institutes, the College host lectures and other special events and may publish a journal. The Center for Arab and Islamic Studies (originally called the Institute for Contemporary Arab and Islamic Studies) was established in 1983 to serve students who wish to specialize in Arab affairs and students with a general interest in international affairs. The Institute sponsors an undergraduate certificate program in Arab and Islamic studies, in conjunction with a regular major. As a scholarly forum, the Institute organizes conferences, lectures, and cultural events.

scopecontent.p: This is a collection of records of Villanova University Centers. The only center currently documented here is the Center for Arab and Islamic Studies. Materials include meeting minutes (1986-1994); annual reports (1992-1994); a 1994 brochure for the center; and a proposal for a concentration in Arab and Islamic Studies (1982), along with a description of the program (1983).
